metadata.title: The delay between login prompts following a failed login attempt must be at least 4 seconds.
metadata.description: Enforcing a delay between successive failed login attempts increases protection against automated password guessing attacks.

criterion.comment: SLEEPTIME is set to 4 or more in /etc/default/login

metadata.title: The system must require at least eight characters be changed between the old and new passwords during a password change.
metadata.description: To ensure that password changes are effective in their goals, the system must ensure that old and new passwords have significant differences. Without significant changes, new passwords may be easily guessed based on the value of a previously compromised password.

criterion.comment: /etc/default/passwd MINDIFF setting >= 8

metadata.title: The system must prohibit the reuse of passwords within five iterations.
metadata.description: If a user, or root, used the same password continuously or was allowed to change it back shortly after being forced to change it to something else, it would provide a potential intruder with the opportunity to keep guessing at one user's password until it was guessed correctly.

criterion.comment: HISTORY setting in /etc/default/passwd >= 5

metadata.title: The system must prevent the root account from directly logging in except from the system console.
metadata.description: Limiting the root account direct logins to only system consoles protects the root account from direct unauthorized access from a non-console device.

criteria.comment: non-global zone, or CONSOLE configured correctly

criterion.comment: /etc/default/login CONSOLE=/dev/console

metadata.title: Run control scripts' executable search paths must contain only absolute paths.
metadata.description: The executable search path (typically the PATH environment variable) contains a list of directories for the shell to search to find executables. If this path includes the current working directory or other relative paths, executables in these directories may be executed instead of system commands. This variable is formatted as a colon-separated list of directories. If there is an empty entry, such as a leading or trailing colon or two consecutive colons, this is interpreted as the current working directory. Paths starting with a slash (/) are absolute paths.

criterion.comment: test paths for /etc/rc*/*
test paths for /etc/init.d/*
test paths for /lib/svc/method/*
test paths for /etc/rc*

metadata.title: The system must implement non-executable program stacks.
metadata.description: A common type of exploit is the stack buffer overflow. An application receives, from an attacker, more data than it is prepared for and stores this information on its stack, writing beyond the space reserved for it. This can be designed to cause execution of the data written on the stack. One mechanism to mitigate this vulnerability is for the system to not allow the execution of instructions in sections of memory identified as part of the stack.

criteria.comment: The system, if a global zone, must implement non-executable program stacks.

criterion.comment: "noexec_user_stack" is set to "1" in /etc/system.

metadata.title: All .Xauthority files must have mode 0600 or less permissive.
metadata.description: .Xauthority files ensure that the user is authorized to access that specific X Windows host. Excessive permissions may permit unauthorized modification of these files, which could lead to denial of service to authorized access or allow unauthorized access to be obtained.

criteria.comment: All .Xauthority files must have mode 0600 or less permissive

criterion.comment: .Xauthority files must have mode 0600 or less permissive

metadata.title: The operating system must protect against an individual falsely denying having performed a particular action. In order to do so the system must be configured to send audit records to a remote audit server.
metadata.description: Keeping audit records on a remote system reduces the likelihood of audit records being changed or corrupted. Duplicating and protecting the audit trail on a separate system reduces the likelihood of an individual being able to deny performing an action.

extend_definition.comment: pass if not a global zone

criterion.comment: There must be an audit_warn entry listed in /etc/mail/aliases.

metadata.title: The finger daemon package must not be installed.
metadata.description: Finger is an unsecure protocol.

criterion.comment: Finger must not be listed under the smf.
/usr/sbin/in.fingerd does not exist

metadata.title: The legacy remote network access utilities daemons must not be installed.
metadata.description: Legacy remote access utilities allow remote control of a system without proper authentication.

criterion.comment: SMF has no legacy remote network access services

metadata.title: The NIS package must not be installed.
metadata.description: NIS is an insecure protocol.

criterion.comment: SMF has no NIS services

metadata.title: The pidgin IM client package must not be installed.
metadata.description: Instant messaging is an insecure protocol.

criterion.comment: /usr/bin/pidgin does not exist

metadata.title: The FTP daemon must not be installed unless required.
metadata.description: FTP is an insecure protocol.

criterion.comment: FTP service is not installed

metadata.title: The TFTP service daemon must not be installed unless required.
metadata.description: TFTP is an insecure protocol.

criterion.comment: SMF does not have the TFTP service

metadata.title: The telnet service daemon must not be installed unless required.
metadata.description: service/network/telnet

criterion.comment: SMF does not have the Telnet service

metadata.title: The UUCP service daemon must not be installed unless required.
metadata.description: UUCP is an insecure protocol.

criterion.comment: SMF does not have the UUCP service

metadata.title: The VNC server package must not be installed unless required.
metadata.description: The VNC service uses weak authentication capabilities and provides the user complete graphical system access.

criterion.comment: SMF does not have the VNC service

metadata.title: The OS must disable information system functionality that provides the capability for automatic execution of code on mobile devices without user direction.
metadata.description: Auto execution vulnerabilities can result in malicious programs being automatically executed.

criterion.comment: Determine if the removable media volume manager is running.

metadata.title: User passwords must be at least 15 characters in length.
metadata.description: Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting guessing and brute-force attacks.

criterion.comment: Check the default password length setting.

metadata.title: The system must require passwords to contain at least one uppercase alphabetic character.
metadata.description: Complex passwords can reduce the likelihood of success of automated password-guessing attacks.

criterion.comment: Check the system default password MINUPPER setting.

metadata.title: The system must require passwords to contain at least one lowercase alphabetic character.
metadata.description: Complex passwords can reduce the likelihood of success of automated password-guessing attacks.

criterion.comment: Check the system default password MINLOWER setting.

metadata.title: The system must require passwords to contain at least one numeric character.
metadata.description: Complex passwords can reduce the likelihood of success of automated password-guessing attacks.

criterion.comment: Check the system default password MINDIGIT setting.

metadata.title: The system must require passwords to contain at least one special character.
metadata.description: Complex passwords can reduce the likelihood of success of automated password-guessing attacks.

criterion.comment: Check the system default password MINSPECIAL setting.

metadata.title: The system must require passwords to not have more than 3 consecutive repeating characters.
metadata.description: Complex passwords can reduce the likelihood of success of automated password-guessing attacks.

criterion.comment: Check the system default password MAXREPEATS setting.

metadata.title: The operating system must implement transaction recovery for transaction-based systems.
metadata.description: Recovery and reconstitution constitutes executing an operation system contingency plan comprised of activities to restore essential missions and buisness functions.

criterion.comment: no non-logging file systems are mounted

metadata.title: The system must not have accounts configured with blank or null passwords.
metadata.description: Complex passwords can reduce the likelihood of success of automated password-guessing attacks.

criterion.comment: Make sure no accounts have blank (null) passwords.

metadata.title: The operating system must be a supported release.
metadata.description: An operating system release is considered supported if the vendor continues to provide security patches for the product. With an unsupported release, it will not be possible to resolve security issues discovered in the system software.

criterion.comment: Installed operating system's name is SunOS
Installed operating system is release 5.11

metadata.title: The system must require users to re-authenticate to unlock a graphical desktop environment.
metadata.description: Allowing access to a graphical environment when the user is not attending the system can allow unauthorized users access to the system.

extend_definition.comment: Pass if XWindows is not in use.

criterion.comment: XScreenSaver must have a timeout of 15 minutes.
XScreenSaver must have a lockTimeout of 0:00:05.
XScreenSaver must have a lock field set to true.
Each user's .xscreensaver must have a lock field set to true.
Each user's .xscreensaver must have a lockTimeout of 5 seconds.
Each user's .xscreensaver must have a timeout of 15 minutes.

metadata.title: All .Xauthority files must have mode 0600 or less permissive.
metadata.description: All .Xauthority files ensure the user is authorized to access the specific X Windows host. Excessive permissions may permit unauthorized modification.Xauthority files ensure that the user is authorized to access that specific X Windows host. Excessive permissions may permit unauthorized modification of these files, which could lead to denial of service to authorized access or allow unauthorized access to be obtained.

extend_definition.comment: Pass if XWindows is not in use.
.Xautority files for each user must be 0600 or less permissive.

metadata.title: The system must prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.
metadata.description: The use of common words in passwords simplifies password-cracking attacks.

criterion.comment: Check in /etc/default/passwd that DICTIONLIST is set to /usr/share/lib/dict/words.
Check in /etc/default/passwd that DICTIONDBDIR is set to /var/passwd.
Check to make sure that /usr/share/lib/dict/words exists and is not empty.
Check to make sure that pw_dict.hwm exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR and is not empty.
Check to make sure that pw_dict.pwd exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR and is not empty.
Check to make sure that pw_dict.pwi exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR and is not empty.
Check to make sure that authtok_check.lock exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR.

metadata.title: The system must restrict the ability of users to assume excessive privileges to members of a defined group and prevent unauthorized users from accessing administrative tools.
metadata.description: Allowing any user to elevate their privileges can allow them excessive control of the system tools.

criterion.comment: Root must be configured as a role.
At least one local user must be assigned the root role.

metadata.title: The default umask for system and users must be 077.
metadata.description: Setting a very secure default value for umask ensures that users make a conscious choice about their file permissions.

criterion.comment: Check the umask setting in every user initialization file to make sure it is 077.
Check the umask setting in the default login file to make sure it is 077.
Check each user account to make sure each has a .profile user initialization file.

metadata.title: The system must not allow users to configure .forward files.
metadata.description: Use of the .forward file poses a security risk in that sensitive data may be inadvertently transferred outside the organization. The .forward file also poses a secondary risk as it can be used to execute commands that may perform unintended actions.

criterion.comment: no user .forward files exist

metadata.title: User .netrc files must not exist.
metadata.description: The .netrc file presents a significant security risk since it stores passwords in unencrypted form.

criterion.comment: .netrc files do not exist

metadata.title: The default umask for FTP users must be 077.
metadata.description: Setting a very secure default value for umask ensures that users make a conscious choice about their file permissions.

criterion.comment: Check to see if the FTP service is listed under the SMF.
FTP umask value must be set to 077.

metadata.title: Reserved UIDs 0-99 must only be used by system accounts.
metadata.description: If a user is assigned a UID that is in the reserved range, even if it is not presently in use, security exposures can arise if a subsequently installed application uses the same UID.

criterion.comment: accounts with reserved UIDs match known system accounts

metadata.title: Login services for serial ports must be disabled.
metadata.description: Login services should not be enabled on any serial ports that are not strictly required to support the mission of the system. This action can be safely performed even when console access is provided using a serial port.

criterion.comment: svc:/system/console-login:terma is disabled
svc:/system/console-login:termb is disabled

metadata.title: The nobody access for RPC encryption key storage service must be disabled.
metadata.description: If login by the user "nobody" is allowed for secure RPC, there is an increased risk of system compromise. If keyserv holds a private key for the "nobody" user, it will be used by key_encryptsession to compute a magic phrase which can be easily recovered by a malicious user.

criterion.comment: Check to see that nobody keys are disabled.

metadata.title: X11 forwarding for SSH must be disabled.
metadata.description: As enabling X11 Forwarding on the host can permit a malicious user to secretly open another X11 connection to another remote client during the session and perform unobtrusive activities such as keystroke monitoring, if the X11 services are not required for the system's intended function, they should be disabled or restricted as appropriate to the user's needs.

criterion.comment: X11Forwarding must be set to no in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: Consecutive login attempts for SSH must be limited to 3.
metadata.description: Determine if consecutive login attempts are limited to 3.

criteria.comment: The system must disconnect and force a reconnect after 3 failed login attempts.

criterion.comment: MaxAuthTries is set to 6 in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.
MaxAuthTriesLog is set to 6 in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: The rhost-based authentication for SSH must be diabled.
metadata.description: Setting this parameter forces users to enter a password with SSH.

criterion.comment: IgnoreRhosts is unset or set to yes in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: Direct root account login must not be permitted for SSH access.
metadata.description: The system should not allow users to log in as the root user directly, as audited actions would be non-attributable to a specific user.

criterion.comment: PermitRootLogin is set to no in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: All interactive user home directories defined in the /etc/passwd file must exist.
metadata.description: If a user has a home directory defined that does not exist, the user may be given the / directory, by default, as the current working directory upon logon. This could create a denial of service because the user would not be able to perform useful tasks in this location.

criteria.comment: Verify all user home directories exist

criterion.comment: Verify all user home directories exist

metadata.title: Login must not be permitted with empty/null passwords for SSH.
metadata.description: Permitting login without a password is inherently risky.

criterion.comment: PermitEmptyPasswords is set to no in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: The operating system must terminate all sessions and network connections when non-local maintenance is completed.
metadata.description: Determines if SSH is configured to disconnect sessions after 10 minutes of inactivity.

criteria.comment: The system is configured to disconnect SSH after 10 minutes of inactivity.

criterion.comment: ClientAliveInterval is set to 600 in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.
ClientAliveCountMax is set to 0 in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: The .rhosts file must not be supported in PAM.
metadata.description: .rhosts files are used to specify a list of hosts that are permitted remote access to a particular account without authenticating. The use of such a mechanism defeats strong identification and authentication requirements.

criterion.comment: No files in /etc/pam.d contain the line pam_rhosts_auth.so.1 in /etc/pam.d/.

metadata.title: Groups assigned to users must exist in the /etc/group file.
metadata.description: Groups defined in passwd but not in group file pose a threat to system security since group permissions are not properly managed.

criterion.comment: Groups listed in the /etc/passwd file must exist.

metadata.title: The use of FTP must be restricted.
metadata.description: FTP is an insecure protocol that transfers files and credentials in clear text, and can be replaced by using SFTP. However, if FTP is permitted for use in the environment, it is important to ensure that the default "system" accounts are not permitted to transfer files via FTP, especially the root role. Consider also adding the names of other privileged or shared accounts that may exist on the system such as user "oracle" and the account which the web server process runs under.

criterion.comment: Check to see if the FTP service is listed under the SMF.
ftpusers contains aiuser
ftpusers contains noaccess
ftpusers contains nobody
ftpusers contains nobody4
ftpusers contains all system users

metadata.title: User .rhosts files must not exist.
metadata.description: Even though the .rhosts files are ineffective if support is disabled in /etc/pam.conf, they may have been brought over from other systems and could contain information useful to an attacker for those other systems.

criterion.comment: .rhosts files do not exist

metadata.title: The system must not allow autologin capabilities from the GNOME desktop.
metadata.description: As automatic logins are a known security risk for other than "kiosk" types of systems, GNOME automatic login should be disabled in pam.conf.

criterion.comment: /etc/pam.d/gdm-autologin contains no auth or account entries

metadata.title: Permissions on user .netrc files must be 750 or less permissive.
metadata.description: .netrc files may contain unencrypted passwords that can be used to attack other systems.

criterion.comment: .netrc files are 750 or less permissive

metadata.title: Unauthorized use of the at or cron capabilities must not be permitted.
metadata.description: On many systems, only the system administrator needs the ability to schedule jobs. Even though a given user is not listed in the "cron.allow" file, cron jobs can still be run as that user. The "cron.allow" file only controls administrative access to the "crontab" command for scheduling and modifying cron jobs. Much more effective access controls for the cron system can be obtained by using Role-Based Access Controls (RBAC).

criterion.comment: Check to make sure that there is no (/etc/cron.d/cron.deny) file.
Check to make sure that there is no (/etc/cron.d/at.deny) file.
Check to make sure that the (/etc/cron.d/at.allow) file is empty.
Check to make sure that the (/etc/cron.d/cron.allow) file has an entry for root and only an entry for root.

metadata.title: The operating system, upon successful logon, must display to the user the date and time of the last logon (access).
metadata.description: Specifies whether sshd should print the date and time of the last user login when a user logs in interactively. The default is "yes".

criterion.comment: Check "PrintLastLog" is set to "yes" or nonexistent in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

metadata.title: Permissions on user home directories must be 750 or less permissive.
metadata.description: Group-writable or world-writable user home directories may enable malicious users to steal or modify other users' data or to gain another user's system privileges.

criterion.comment: user home directory permissions are 750 or less permissive

metadata.title: The operating system session lock mechanism, when activated on a device with a display screen, must place a publicly viewable pattern onto the associated display, hiding what was previously visible on the screen.
metadata.description: A session time-out lock is a temporary action taken when a user stops work and moves away from the immediate physical vicinity of the system but does not log out because of the temporary nature of the absence.

extend_definition.comment: Pass if XWindows is not in use.

criterion.comment: The XScreenSaver file must list blank as the mode.
All user .xscreensaver files must list blank as the mode.

metadata.title: The operating system must not allow logins for users with blank passwords.
metadata.description: If the password field is blank and the system does not enforce a policy that passwords are required, it could allow login without proper authentication of a user.

criterion.comment: PASSREQ line in /etc/default/login.

metadata.title: The operating system must employ FIPS-validated or NSA-approved cryptography to implement digital signatures.
metadata.description: FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating cryptographic modules, and NSA Type-X (where X=1, 2, 3, 4) products are NSA-certified hardware based encryption modules.

extend_definition.comment: pass if not a global zone

criterion.comment: FIPS mode system parameter is enabled
FIPS mode PKCS11 parameter is enabled

metadata.title: The FTP service must display the DoD approved system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system.
metadata.description: Warning messages inform users who are attempting to log in to the system of organization that owns the system and any monitoring policies that are in place. As implementing a logon banner to deter inappropriate use can provide a foundation for legal action against abuse, this warning content should be set as appropriate.

criterion.comment: The FTP server package is not installed (/usr/lib/inet/proftpd does not exist)
DisplayConnect is configured in /etc/proftpd.conf.
The proper DoD login banner message text is set.

metadata.title: The operating system must display the DoD approved system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system for general system logons.
metadata.description: Warning messages inform users who are attempting to log in to the system of their legal status regarding the system and must include the name of the organization that owns the system and any monitoring policies that are in place. As implementing a logon banner to deter inappropriate use can provide a foundation for legal action against abuse, this warning content should be set as appropriate.

criteria.comment: configured correctly or X not in use

criterion.comment: Check to make sure that /etc/issue contains the DoD required banner message text.
/etc/gdm/Init/Default approved zenity line exists

metadata.title: The operating system must display the DoD approved system use notification message or banner for SSH connections.
metadata.description: Warning messages inform users who are attempting to log in to the system of their legal status regarding the system and must include the name of the organization that owns the system and any monitoring policies that are in place. As implementing a logon banner to deter inappropriate use can provide a foundation for legal action against abuse, this warning content should be set as appropriate.

criterion.comment: Check to make sure that /etc/ssh/sshd_config references /etc/issue for the Banner.
Check to make sure that /etc/issue contains the DoD logon banner.

metadata.title: The operating system must display the DoD approved system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system for general system logons.
metadata.description: Warning messages inform users who are attempting to log in to the system of their legal status regarding the system and must include the name of the organization that owns the system and any monitoring policies that are in place. As implementing a logon banner to deter inappropriate use can provide a foundation for legal action against abuse, this warning content should be set as appropriate.

criterion.comment: Check to make sure that /etc/motd contains the DoD required banner message text.
Check to make sure that /etc/issue contains the DoD required banner message text.

metadata.title: Systems must employ cryptographic hashes for passwords using the SHA-2 family of algorithms or FIPS 140-2 approved successors.
metadata.description: Cryptographic hashes provide quick password authentication while not actually storing the password.

criteria.comment: The password hashes stored on the system must have been generated using a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm.

criterion.comment: CRYPT_DEFAULT is set to 5
CRYPT_ALGORITHMS_ALLOW is set to 5,6

metadata.title: The limitpriv zone option must be set to the vendor default or less permissive.
metadata.description: Solaris zones can be assigned privileges generally reserved for the global zone using the "limitpriv" zone option. Any privilege assignments in excess of the vendor defaults may provide the ability for a non-global zone to compromise the global zone.

extend_definition.comment: pass if not a global zone

criterion.comment: Make sure that all the different zones on the system have their limitpriv attribute set to default.

metadata.title: The /etc/zones directory, and its contents, must have the vendor default owner, group, and permissions.
metadata.description: Incorrect ownership can result in unauthorized changes or theft of data.

extend_definition.comment: pass if not a global zone

criterion.comment: The (/etc/zones) folder must have the system default file permissions of 755.
The (/etc/zones/index) file must have the system default file permissions of 0644.

metadata.title: Solaris Global Zone
metadata.description: The system is a Solaris Global Zone

criterion.comment: /etc/zones/index does not exist
/etc/zones/index contains global

metadata.title: Auditing enabled or not global zone
metadata.description: Audit service is running or not in a global zone.

criterion.comment: auditd is online

metadata.title: Users must have a valid home directory assignment.
metadata.description: All users must be assigned a home directory in the passwd file. Failure to have a home directory may result in the user being put in the root directory.

criterion.comment: user home directory assignments are not blank

metadata.title: All system start-up files must be owned by root.
metadata.description: System start-up files not owned by root could lead to system compromise by allowing malicious users or applications to modify them for unauthorized purposes. This could lead to system and network compromise.

criterion.comment: All files under /etc/rc* and init.d directories are owned by root

metadata.title: The operating system must reveal error messages only to authorized personnel.
metadata.description: Proper file permissions and ownership ensures that only designated personnel in the organization can access error messages.

criterion.comment: The /var/adm/messages file must be owned by Root and of the Root group. Also, the file permissions must be 640.
The /var/adm folder must be owned by Root and of the System group. Also, the file permissions must be 750.

metadata.title: The operating system must monitor for unauthorized connections of mobile devices to organizational information systems.
metadata.description: Mobile devices include portable storage media (e.g., USB memory sticks, external hard disk drives) and portable computing and communications devices with information storage capability (e.g., notebook/laptop computers, personal digital assistants, cellular telephones, digital cameras, audio recording devices).

extend_definition.comment: pass if not a global zone

criterion.comment: Determine if USB mass storage devices are locked out by the kernel.

metadata.title: All run control scripts must have mode 0755 or less permissive.
metadata.description: If the startup files are writable by other users, these users could modify the startup files to insert malicious commands into the startup files.

criterion.comment: All files under /etc/rc* directories must have file permissions of 0755 or less.
All files under the /lib/svc/method directory must have file permissions of 0755 or less.

metadata.title: All system start-up files must be group-owned by root, sys, or bin.
metadata.description: If system start-up files do not have a group owner of root or a system group, the files may be modified by malicious users or intruders.

criterion.comment: All files under /etc/rc* and init.d directories have group owner root, sys, or bin

metadata.title: The root account must be the only account with GID of 0.
metadata.description: All accounts with a GID of 0 have root group privileges and must be limited to the group account only.

criterion.comment: The root account must be the only account with GID of 0.
GID 0 must only be assigned to root.

metadata.title: The system must disable accounts after three consecutive unsuccessful login attempts.
metadata.description: Allowing continued access to accounts on the system exposes them to brute-force password-guessing attacks.

criterion.comment: LOCK_AFTER_RETRIES == YES in /etc/security/policy.conf
RETRIES <= 3 in /etc/default/login
lock_after_retries != no in /etc/user_attr

metadata.title: Solaris 11 XWindows Check.
metadata.description: XWindows is being run by the system.

criterion.comment: Check to see if XWindows is being run by the system.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: HISTORY setting in /etc/default/passwd >= 5

password_test.comment: The root account must be the only account with GID of 0.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: SLEEPTIME is set to 4 or more in /etc/default/login
/etc/default/passwd MINDIFF setting >= 8
/etc/default/login CONSOLE=/dev/console
"noexec_user_stack" is set to "1" in /etc/system.

file_test.comment: .Xauthority files must have mode 0600 or less permissive

uname_test.comment: Installed operating system's name is SunOS

textfilecontent54_test.comment: There must be an audit_warn entry listed in /etc/mail/aliases.

solaris-def:smf_test.comment: Finger must not be listed under the smf.
SMF has no legacy remote network access services

file_test.comment: /usr/bin/pidgin does not exist

solaris-def:smf_test.comment: SMF does not have the TFTP service
SMF does not have the Telnet service
SMF does not have the UUCP service
SMF does not have the VNC service
Determine if the removable media volume manager is running.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Check the default password length setting.
Check the system default password MINUPPER setting.
Check the system default password MINLOWER setting.
Check the system default password MINDIGIT setting.
Check the system default password MINSPECIAL setting.
Check the system default password MAXREPEATS setting.
no non-logging file systems are mounted

shadow_test.comment: Make sure no accounts have blank (null) passwords.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: XScreenSaver must have a timeout of 15 minutes.
XScreenSaver must have a lockTimeout of 0:00:05.
XScreenSaver must have a lock field set to true.
Each user's .xscreensaver must have a lock field set to true.
Each user's .xscreensaver must have a lockTimeout of 5 seconds.
XScreenSaver must have a timeout of 15 minutes.
Check in /etc/default/passwd that DICTIONLIST is set to /usr/share/lib/dict/words.
Check in /etc/default/passwd that DICTIONDBDIR is set to /var/passwd.

file_test.comment: Check to make sure that /usr/share/lib/dict/words exists and is not empty.
Check to make sure that pw_dict.hwm exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR and is not empty.
Check to make sure that pw_dict.pwd exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR and is not empty.
Check to make sure that pw_dict.pwi exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR and is not empty.
Check to make sure that authtok_check.lock exists in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Root must be configured as a role.
At least one local user must be assigned the root role.
Check the umask setting in every user initialization file to make sure it is 077.
Check the umask setting in the default login file to make sure it is 077.

password_test.comment: The home directories of all user accounts that don't have .profile files.

file_test.comment: no user .forward files exist
.netrc files do not exist

solaris-def:smf_test.comment: Check to see if the FTP service is listed under the SMF.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: FTP umask value must be set to 077.

password_test.comment: accounts with reserved UIDs match known system accounts

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Check to see that nobody keys are disabled.
X11Forwarding must be set to no in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: IgnoreRhosts is unset or set to yes in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.
PermitRootLogin is set to no in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

password_test.comment: Verify all user home directories exist

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: PermitEmptyPasswords is set to no in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.
No files contain pam_rhosts_auth.so.1 line(s) in /etc/pam.d/

password_test.comment: Groups listed in the /etc/passwd file must exist.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: ftpusers contains aiuser
ftpusers contains noaccess
ftpusers contains nobody
ftpusers contains nobody4

file_test.comment: .rhosts files do not exist

textfilecontent54_test.comment: /etc/pam.d/gdm-autologin contains no auth or account entries

file_test.comment: Check to make sure that there is no (/etc/cron.d/cron.deny) file.
Check to make sure that there is no (/etc/cron.d/at.deny) file.
Check to make sure that the (/etc/cron.d/at.allow) file is empty.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Check to make sure that the (/etc/cron.d/cron.allow) file has an entry for root.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Check "PrintLastLog" is set to "yes" or nonexistent in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.

file_test.comment: user home directory permissions are 750 or less permissive

textfilecontent54_test.comment: The XScreenSaver file must list blank as the mode.
All user .xscreensaver files must list blank as the mode.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: FIPS mode system parameter is enabled
FIPS mode PKCS11 parameter is enabled

file_test.comment: The FTP server package is not installed (/usr/lib/inet/proftpd does not exist)

textfilecontent54_test.comment: The proper DoD login banner message text is set.
/etc/gdm/Init/Default approved zenity line exists
Check to make sure that /etc/ssh/sshd_config references /etc/issue for the Banner.
Check to make sure that /etc/issue contains the DoD logon banner.
Check to make sure that /etc/motd contains the DoD required banner message text.
Check to make sure that /etc/issue contains the DoD required banner message text.

xmlfilecontent_test.comment: Make sure that all the different zones on the system have their limitpriv attribute set to default.

file_test.comment: The (/etc/zones) folder must have the system default file permissions of 0755.
The (/etc/zones/index) filer must have the system default file permissions of 0644.
/etc/zones/index does not exist

textfilecontent54_test.comment: /etc/zones/index contains global

password_test.comment: user home directory assignments are not blank

file_test.comment: All files under /etc/rc* and /etc/init.d directories must have file permissions of 0755 or less.
The /var/adm/messages file must be owned by Root and of the Root group. Also, the file permissions must be 640.
The /var/adm folder must be owned by Root and of the System group. Also, the file permissions must be 750.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Determine if USB mass storage devices are locked out by the kernel.

file_test.comment: All files under /etc/rc* and /etc/init.d directories must have file permissions of 0755 or less.
All files under the /lib/svc/method directory must have file permissions of 0755 or less.
All files under /etc/rc* and init.d directories have group owner root, sys, or bin

textfilecontent54_test.comment: GID 0 must only be assigned to root.
LOCK_AFTER_RETRIES == YES in /etc/security/policy.conf
RETRIES <= 3 in /etc/default/login
lock_after_retries != no in /etc/user_attr

solaris-def:smf_test.comment: Check to see if XWindows is being run by the system.

file_object.comment: Does pw_dict.hwm exist in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR.
Does pw_dict.pwd exist in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR.
Does pw_dict.pwi exist in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR.
Does authtok_check.lock exist in the path specified by DICTONDBDIR.

The home directories of all user accounts that don't have .profile files.
